This is a pure documentation/reference skill containing legitimate scikit-learn ML examples with no network calls, credential access, or file exfiltration capabilities.

content.value_statement: Build machine learning models quickly with scikit-learn guidance. Covers classification, regression, clustering, preprocessing, pipelines, and model evaluation with ready-to-use examples.
actual_capabilities: Build classification and regression models with scikit-learn algorithms
Perform clustering analysis with K-Means, DBSCAN, and other algorithms
Create ML pipelines to prevent data leakage and streamline workflows
Preprocess data with scaling, encoding, and imputation techniques
Evaluate models using cross-validation, metrics, and hyperparameter tuning
Apply dimensionality reduction with PCA, t-SNE, and UMAP
limitations: Requires scikit-learn and dependencies to be installed separately
Does not provide deep learning or neural network frameworks
No auto-ML or model selection recommendations beyond guidance
Performance depends on user's data quality and preprocessing

use_cases.title: Build production ML pipelines
use_cases.description: Create end-to-end ML workflows with preprocessing, model training, evaluation, and hyperparameter tuning.

use_cases.title: Compare ML algorithms
use_cases.description: Evaluate different classifiers, regressors, and clustering methods using standardized metrics and cross-validation.

use_cases.title: Apply unsupervised learning
use_cases.description: Discover patterns in data using clustering, dimensionality reduction, and outlier detection techniques.

prompt_templates.title: Quick classification
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a classification model using scikit-learn. Use the breast cancer dataset. Train with train-test split, StandardScaler preprocessing, RandomForest classifier, and show classification report.

prompt_templates.title: Clustering analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform clustering analysis on the iris dataset using scikit-learn. Compare K-Means, DBSCAN, and AgglomerativeClustering. Use elbow method and silhouette score to find optimal clusters. Visualize results with PCA.

prompt_templates.title: ML pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a complete ML pipeline with ColumnTransformer for mixed numeric and categorical data. Include preprocessing (imputation, scaling, encoding), PCA for dimensionality reduction, and GradientBoosting classifier. Use GridSearchCV for hyperparameter tuning.

prompt_templates.title: Model evaluation
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate a classification model using cross-validation. Show accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, and ROC AUC. Create confusion matrix and learning curves. Compare with stratified k-fold for imbalanced classes.

output_examples.input: Build a classification model to predict customer churn
output: Preprocessing: StandardScaler for numeric features, OneHotEncoder for categorical
Top predictive features: contract_type, monthly_charges, tenure
Recommendations: Consider GradientBoosting for higher accuracy, collect more features about customer complaints

best_practices: Always use Pipelines to prevent data leakage in cross-validation
Scale features before training algorithms that require normalized inputs (SVM, KNN, Neural Networks)
Use stratified splitting for classification to preserve class distribution
anti_patterns: Fitting preprocessing on all data before splitting (causes data leakage)
Using accuracy alone for imbalanced classification problems
Not setting random_state for reproducibility in experiments

faq.question: Which algorithm should I start with for classification?
faq.answer: Start with LogisticRegression as a fast baseline, then try RandomForest as a robust default.

faq.question: Do I need to scale features for all algorithms?
faq.answer: No. Tree-based models do not require scaling. Scale for SVM, KNN, Neural Networks, PCA, and linear models.

faq.question: How do I handle mixed numeric and categorical features?
faq.answer: Use ColumnTransformer to apply different preprocessing to different columns.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these scripts?
faq.answer: Yes. Scripts run locally using scikit-learn APIs. They only read data you provide and process in memory.

faq.question: Why is my model not converging?
faq.answer: Increase max_iter parameter or scale your features. For linear models, try StandardScaler.

faq.question: How does this compare to TensorFlow or PyTorch?
faq.answer: Scikit-learn excels at classical ML with structured data. Use TensorFlow or PyTorch for deep learning.
